title: Calories in 1 Oz of Vodka
meta_description: Learn calories in oz of vodka (about 64 kcal per 1 oz serving), plus full nutrition breakdown, proof variations, and FAQs for mixers.
assumptions: Standard 80-proof (40% ABV) unflavored vodka; 1 oz ≈ 30 ml; no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by proof, brand, distillation, and any flavors/sugars; alcohol content affects calories. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One ounce of 80-proof vodka provides about 64 empty calories from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison; alcohol calories are 'empty' with no macros.

tweaks.label: Mixed with 4 oz diet soda (zero-calorie mixer)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 oz of vodka?
Does vodka have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No—pure vodka has 0 g carbs, protein, or fat; calories are purely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in oz of vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories; e.g., 100-proof adds ~16 kcal per oz vs. 80-proof.

faqs.q: What about calories in a standard shot of vodka?
faqs.a: A 1.5 oz shot is ~96 kcal for 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in vodka?
faqs.a: Minimal—mostly empty calories; no significant vitamins, minerals, or fiber.
